title: How to Design a Simple Antenna

steps.title: Find out what frequency you want.
steps.content: Find out what frequency you want. For Wi-Fi you are using 2.45GHz = 2,450,000,000Hz). This is needed because this determines the length of your antenna.

steps.title: Choose a good conductor.
steps.content: Choose a good conductor. For the example we can use a copper wire and a piece of copper plating. Also you will need a co-axial cable (75 ohm is better than 50 ohm, for Wi-Fi 50 ohm is better than 75 ohm).

steps.title: Work out the length you need the wire to be.
steps.content: Work out the length you need the wire to be. This is done by using the frequency value from step 1 to find the wavelength of the signal. To do this you simply need to divide the speed of light (c = 299 792 458 m/s) by the frequency (f). In the case of 2.45GHz the wavelength is 12.236 centimeter (4.8 in). Usually monopole antennas are quarter-wavelength structures, so the length of the wire should be 12.236/4 = 3.0509cm

steps.title: Cut the wire a little bigger than you need, about 6.5 centimeter (2.6 in) or so for a half-wave dipole antenna.
steps.content: Cut the wire a little bigger than you need, about 6.5 centimeter (2.6 in) or so for a half-wave dipole antenna. Cut about 3.2 centimeter (1.3 in) for a quarter-wave monopole. This way you can pare it back based on performance (and "tune" if needed) .

steps.title: This is basically used to form a theoretical mirror image of the antenna.
steps.content: This is basically used to form a theoretical mirror image of the antenna. Simply use the copper plate that you picked up earlier. It should be at least half a wavelength square.

steps.title: Drill a hole in the center of the plate.
steps.content: Drill a hole in the center of the plate. The whole should be just big enough for the co-axial cable to fit through.

steps.title: Pare the coax cable to reveal its ground [outer conductor].
steps.content: Pare the coax cable to reveal its ground [outer conductor]. This can be pulled back to reveal the inside insulator.

steps.title: Push the cable through so that the start of outer insulation is flush with the hole.
steps.content: Push the cable through so that the start of outer insulation is flush with the hole. The ground conductor is now above the ground-plane. Fold the ground conductor back and solder it to the copper ground plane.

steps.title: Pare the inside insulation back to reveal the signal conductor.
steps.content: Pare the inside insulation back to reveal the signal conductor.

steps.title: Solder the copper wire to the signal conductor of the coax.
steps.content: Solder the copper wire to the signal conductor of the coax. You now have an antenna.
